data.title: Large menu
data.text: We stumbled upon this place on a recent visit. The menu was large and we had a hard time deciding. We finally decided on 2 rolls, animal style and the Refreshing. Both were fabulous. We loved the citrus flavor of the refreshing. We like to try unique rolls and these were both different from anything we have ever had. My husband always orders seaweed salad whenever we go for sushi and this did not disappoint. The texture was perfect and is had a wonderful sesame flavor. We also had the Hawaiian Ceviche. That was my favorite dish of the night. The fish was in large pieces so you really got the flavor. And I love the coconut milk that added a creaminess. Servers  kept our drinks refilled and checked on us the appropriate amount of times. Will definitely go back when in the area.

data.title: Great value for lunch
data.text:
Found this place whilst walking down Main Street 
Sat outside to enjoy the street scene and the sunshine 
Had a look at menu and decided to order a Bento box and a bowl of chicken teriyaki fir $5.95 which also came with bowl of miso soup!!

Amazing I expected a tiny meal and got heaps the only complaint is that the bowl of chicken teriyaki was bland whereas the bento box chicken was much nicer 

Fantastic value for lunch though!!

data.title: Sushi fusion even picky kids like
data.text: This is not a "standard" sushi place.  It has managed to fuse a sense of Thai, American and other food contexts into the menu.  We had a number of "tapas" and found all quite enjoyable.  Yes, sushi but with a nice twist.

data.title: Sushi on Fire for sure
data.text: One of the top 2 sushi places in HB. I'm local and this is definitely one of the better places around. It is usually fairly busy.

data.title: Just ok sushi
data.text:
We stayed in the Huntington Beach area for several days.   On our last night, we met several relatives at Sushi On Fire for dinner but the place was busy on Friday night so the host told us to walk down the street to the sister restaurant that could accommodate a group of 7 which was nice of them.   Once there, we got our table.   Service was good but sushi was just ok to me. My husband and family enjoyed their specialty rolls that they ordered. I ordered several ngiri rolls (uni, tuna, sake and ebi).  I didn't order the specialty Rolls so I can't comment.   My ngiri rice was off.  It doesn't taste like the sushi rice at my favorite sushi restaurant in Minneapolis but the tuna and the salmon were nice size cut. 

I probably would go back if I was in the area again and probably would recommend this place to a friend or relatives.

data.title: Sushi may be on fire, but the noodles are not.
data.text: My friends and I stopped here for dinner and were escorted from the original location a few steps down the street to the second dining room. The rolls were good, nothing special, but the chicken with noodles was bland, the meat was dried out, and the noodles were flavorless and greasy. My friend had an allergic reaction to something in his food. The service was mediocre, not particularly friendly. Eat somewhere else that actually makes an effort.

data.title: Terrible service, average food
data.text: As soon as were seated the staff started shuttling the place down and cleaning up. We spent the entire time feeling like an inconvenience and listening to the noise of the cleanup. To top it all off the sushi was average at best. The fish was very thinly sliced and far from good quality.

data.title: 911 roll
data.text: Really good ! Super fresh, try the Halloween roll! YUM! Reasonable prices...clearly a local hot spot! Easy to park in structure as Sushi on Fire VALIDATES! Trust me, in this area paid parking is a...Bonus!

data.title: Great sushi near the beach!
data.text: Really enjoyed my first visit hear. Huge selection of creative sushi offerings along with all the standard rolls. Very attentive service, and some complementary sake was a very nice touch. The decor is simple and the place is a little noisy, but that just gives it a lively feel.

data.title: A- Experience at Sushi on Fire
data.text:
Sushi - The sushi was fantastic and there are a ton of options for people to choose from. The roles were a lot bigger than what I was used to as well. Their sushi was A+.

Service - Our waiter had little to say to us... Didn't ask how our night was, provide recommendations, etc. He maybe said 10 words to us including when he took our order and refilled drinks. We also felt rushed and received our check in the middle of our meal.  Their service was a D+. 

Location - Sushi on Fire is conveniently located on Main St in Huntington Beach. It's right in the middle and near all of the shopping, bars, clubs, etc.  Their location was an A.

data.title: Sushi californian style
data.text:
For non american resident the californian sushi is always a surprise.
Sushi on fire does american sushi with style.
My personal favourite is newyork steak(not joking)

data.title: HB Sushi Hot Spot
data.text: This is the best Sushi in HB. Very popular place, gets busy Friday, Saturday evening but worth the wait. Staff is great, friendly, attentive. Dragon Roll is yummy! I love the artfulness put into each plate it looks so pretty you want to take a picture (or snap).

data.title: Don't bother with the hype. Plenty of other great places to visit
data.text: After a two hour wait (when we were told it would be 45 minutes for our group) our food came out wrong and then I was yelled at by mama, in front of my family, for only giving an 8% tip. I used to frequent this restaurant. I won't give her another dime. There are so many other sushi restaurants with better quality fish and service that doesn't make you feel like you're being rushed out so she can get more money. Don't bother.

data.title: Best Sushi in HB
data.text: Mama is AMAZING and their sushi is BOMB!!  As a local I rate this place as some of THE BEST sushi in Orange County!  This place can get super crowded and loud - be prepared!  Also Tuesdays are slammed with locals night.  The service is awesome and prices are reasonable - if you like sushi and are new to the area this is HIGHLY recommended!

data.title: Dinner downtown Huntington Beach Ca
data.text: Great food and service. Never disappointed  ...sometimes there's a wait. But the sake fills in the gap . We love the Dragon roll and the Mexican roll!!

data.title: Local night
data.text: Best sushi spot in HB.  It helps when you're a regular and/or local customer because Mama takes care of you!!

data.title: Gluten Free Friendly
data.text: My wife has Celiac disease and is concerned in sushi restaurants about how the rice is prepared and if they have Soy Sauce that is gluten free.  In fact she will bring her own soy sauce if we know we are going to eat at a sushi restaurant new to us.  Gluten won’t kill her like a peanut allergy but it REALLY bothers her stomach.  We were near Sushi on Fire and decided to try it on the spur of the moment.  My wife asked her “gluten” questions of the waitress and rather than give the standard “oh yes, you’ll be fine here” reply the waitress brought the manager out and he carefully went through the menu and also went back and talked to the chef.  They even had Gluten Free Soy Sauce on request.  Plus...the Sushi was fresh and great.

data.title: Great Sushi and Service
data.text: We were seated quickly and our orders taken.   Albfod came out very fast!  Great since it was late and we were hungry.   Service was excellent and we never had to ask for a thing.  This restaurant has great food and knows how to keep tables moving.  It was a Monday night and the restaurant was packed.  We loved it!

data.title: Many choices!
data.text: Love the large selection of sushi. We sat outside and enjoyed the evening people watching. Great food!

data.title: Love!
data.text: Sushi is awesome and great prices! Kids loved the chicken and they even gave free Gummi bears to them!  They also gave us free saki!  Love this place!
